reviewText: Benny Hill is wonderfully funny. I thought that this particular box set was very entertaining. Also the Hill's Angels were very beautiful. The skits were hilariously funny. This box set has some of his better materials in it. Enjoy!

reviewText: Does anyone out there know which dvd compilation of Benny Hill has the poem he recites that has this line in it: "As he passed the water mill, he glanced up the hill to where the Chapel of St. Levi used to stand. And a little farther down, he saw little Father Down who was sitting with his surplus in his hands".I have that on audio tape I recorded back in the 1980's off TV when NBC ran the Benny Hill Show late at night.If ANYONE knows, let me know.

reviewText: These are some of Benny's best and sauciest sketches. It's a great laugh for any Benny Hill fan and the slapstick is as wonderfully entertaining as ever. Great stuff.Sherlock Holmes and the Flying Zombie Death Monkeys

reviewText: This 3rd installment of the Benny Hill Show Complete and Unadulterated The Naughty Years Dvd set has more of Benny's humour and classic charaters imbecile lovable Fred Scuttle,verbally challenged Chinese Chow Mein and the commercial bloppers.The new skits parodies American Tv series such Columbo,Starky & Hutch,Ironside,McCloud,Bionic Woman,The Six Million Dollar Man,Kojak and the British classic Crossroads.The gang is at its best and even Jackie Wright slaps Benny's head in one sketch.Also talented British voice Eddie Buchanan joins the show and the lovely Diana Darvey whose innuendo was too much sexy for the show.Set 4 is due to hit the streets next month.I'll be wait to see Hill's Angels.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love Benny Hill humor. I remember Benny's shows from the eighties that were broadcasted on mexican TV, but here in Mexico they cut everything to half an hour plus commercials and it was almost impossible to see the early seventies stuff. With this dvd I have hours of laughs and good comedy. You can watch this set over and over and never get bored. Really, this is the best comedian of all time.
summary: Benny Hill 70's humor is the best.
Title: N/A

reviewText: By the time of this third DVD series of the Thames Television era of the Benny Hill Show, you can detect the trend which eventually undid Benny as the jokes become more salacious and the girls get closer to nudity.  Thankfully, the clever imitations and TV send ups still dominate so the DVD is still hilarious and the print quality is like new.Has any consideration been given to issuing a CD of some of the singers on the show?  Eddie Buchanan sings a fantastic song called "Going Nowhere" and blows the audience away.

reviewText: Cute and funny.  Benny and his crew are having a good time and it's contagious.Unfortunately, this dvd is rather more naughty than just funny.
summary: Getting too bawdy to be fun

reviewText: If you aren't a Benny Hill fan, than unsure what you are doing looking at this. Benny Hill is Benny Hill. Insane, stupid and just plain wonky. Something I and my husband happen to love! We even recorded the song and use it as a ringtone for our cell phones! If you like Benny Hill you will LOVE these sets! The first season was probably the slowest and least funniest, but it's interesting to see him progress as time moves onward. By second set he's on a roll and making us laugh and laugh!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Anyone who remembers and loves the Benny Hill Show should be pleased with this series of videos. This is especially true of American audiences who never got the full, one hour show as it was originally aired. What we got in this country was a cut down version with emphasis on the comedy sketches. There is no doubt that comedy was Benny Hill's strong point and his talent was great. The shows on these videos include the full variety show format which includes musical and dance numbers as well as some comedy pieces that probably played better to European audiences.All that being said, this particular set is the weakest of the lot thus far. There is more emphasis on scantily clad girls and more material that has been recycled from earlier seasons. Even so, this is an enjoyable set of memories to relive.
Title: N/A

reviewText: What's nice about this is that you see the shows how they were meant to be seen.What I mean is...they were shown differently in the U.K. than in the U.S.In the U.S., only select bits were put together for the U.S. airing.Either because of time or because some people in the U.S. might not "get" the British sense of humor.If you're a Benny Hill fan, you'll be familiar with much on this disc.But you'll also find some skits that are new to you.I recommend it.**********************Update: May 2014Still lovin' it.Great stuff.
summary: A welcome addition to my video library

reviewText: Benny Hill was amazing.  He was so talented and funny.  Now I don't know how widely viewed this was in America, but overseas this was extremely popular and it's not hard to see why millions across the globe tuned in to this guy.  His style of humour is rude, crude and shrewed, but hillarious.  I loved the old man in the skits.They certainly don't make comedy like this anymore and there is something to be said about British humour.  This is really worth taking a look at and I promise you'll laugh out loud all the time.

reviewText: This is quite possibly the best of the Benny Hill sets. When the show was syndicated & crossed over to America in the late 70's, I was watching many of the sketches seen in set three. Benny was definitely at his creative peak during this period. Sketches which stick out in my mind as the funniest are: "Victorian Scandals", "Bionic Baby", "Murder On The Oregon Express", "The Flash" number, and the "Fire Brigade" (with "Robin Hood"), as well as the recurring Fred Scuttle bits & countless impersonations.Set Five is due to be released in a few days; it will be interesting to compare the quality & content of these sets to each other.
summary: Benny really hit his stride with Set Three
